（注）直近1週間の新規陽性者の報告数とその前の1週間の報告数が共に0の場合、増減: (Note) If the number of new positive cases reported in the most recent week and the number of cases reported in the week before are both 0, the number is 1 because there is no change.
（注）集団感染発生や曜日による件数のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こ: (Note) Because the number of cases may vary from day to day due to outbreaks of clusters and days of the week, the moving average of the past seven days was used to calculate the positive rate to smooth out these variations and to see the overall trend. (For example, the positive rate on May 7 was calculated using the actual average for the period from May 1 to May 7.)
妊娠中の方、重症化しやすい方（高齢者、糖尿病、心不全、呼吸器疾患（COPD等）等: If you are pregnant or have an underlying disease such as diabetes, heart failure, respiratory disease (COPD, etc.), dialysis, immunosuppressive drugs, or anti-cancer drugs, please consult with us immediately. Otherwise, if your symptoms last more than 4 days, consult with us.
（注）直近1週間の保健所からの新規陽性者の報告数とその前の1週間の報告数の比率。: (Note) The ratio of the number of new positive cases reported by the health center in the most recent week to the number reported in the week before, with an increase when above 1 and a decrease when below 1
（注）1週間前の新規陽性者の報告数と比較した際の増加比について、有意な数値がとれ: (Note) The increase in the number of new positive cases compared to the number of new positive cases reported one week ago was prepared from March 29, when significant figures were available.
（注）陽性率：陽性判明数の移動平均／（陽性判明数＋陰性判明数）の移動平均: (Note) Positive rate: Moving average of the number of positive results / (number of positive results + number of negative results)
（注）前の1週間の報告数が0の場合、（直近1週間の新規陽性者の報告数平均）＋1で: (Note) If the number of reports in the previous week is 0, the number is (the average number of reports of new positive cases in the previous week) + 1

※「濃厚接触者」は、家族や知人などからの感染の可能性が高い方、クラスターに関係す: (Note) 'Close contacts' are those who are likely to be infected by family members or acquaintances, or who are related to the cluster.
※「新規」は、「濃厚接触者」ではない方を指す。渡航歴がある方、県外感染の可能性が: (Note) "New" refers to those who are not "Close contacts". Those with a history of travel, those with a high probability of out-of-county infection (e.g., returning home), and those with an unknown route of infection.
※「新規の割合」＝（新規）/（計）で算出。端数の関係上、合計しても必ずしも100: (Note) "Percent of new" = (new) / (total). Total of the percents does not necessarily equal 100% due to fractions.
※「全体に占める割合」＝（計）/（累計陽性者数）で算出。端数の関係上、合計しても: (Note) "Percent of the total" = (total) / (Cumulative number of positives). The total of the percent does not necessarily equal 100% due to fractions.
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: Because the number of cases may vary from day to day due to outbreaks of clusters and days of the week, the moving average of the past seven days was used to calculate the positive rate to smooth out these variations and to see the overall trend. (For example, the positive rate on May 7 was calculated using the actual average for the period from May 1 to May 7.)
（注）「軽症」、「中等症」、...、「その他」の割合は、「療養中」に占める割合を: Note: The percentages for "minor", "moderate", "..." and "other" indicate the percentage of "under-treatment".
民間検査機関、帰国者・接触者外来設置等医療機関、その他の検査機関による検査は含ま: Testing by private laboratories, medical institutions with outpatient facilities for returnees and contact persons, and other laboratories are not included.
速報値として公開するものであり、後日確定データとして修正される場合あり: The number is published as preliminary figures and may be revised as confirmed data at a later date
子供たちの学びを支援する様々なウェブサイトを紹介しています。: A variety of websites that support children's learning.
新型コロナウイルス感染症対応についてのお願い: Request for the response to the COVID-19
県が公表しておらず、検査実施人数が不明な日は、陽性者・陰性者ともに0名と表示され: On days when the number of people tested is not announced by the prefecture and the number of people tested is unknown, the number of positive and negative cases is shown as 0.
ご家庭でのマスク等の捨て方（東京都のサイトへ）: How to dispose of masks and other items at home (see the Tokyo Metropolitan Government website)
新型コロナウイルスの感染が判明した方へ（東京都のサイトへ）: For those who are infected with COVID-19 (see by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government website)
県公式情報がほとんど更新されないため、このデータは更新の頻度が低い: This data is infrequently updated because official county information is rarely updated
端数の関係上、合計しても必ずしも100%とはならない: Due to fractions, the total does not necessarily equal 100% of the total.
検査実施件数 合計: The total number of people tested
同一の対象者について複数の検体を検査する場合がある: Multiple specimens may be tested on the same subject
検査実施人数（県衛生研究所・水戸市保健所）: Number of Tested (Prefectural Health Research Institute and Mito City Public Health Center)
検査実施件数（全体）: The total number of people tested
感染経路不明者数推移: Change in the number of people with unknown routes of infection
保健所から発生届が提出された日別（報告日別）の新規陽性者について、感染経路等の不: Newly positive cases by date of outbreak notification (by reporting date) are classified into two categories: those with unknown routes of infection and those with known routes of infection.
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: Because the results may vary from day to day due to variations in outbreaks of clusters and days of the week, the moving average for the past seven days is shown as a line graph to smooth out these variations and see the overall trend. (For example, the positive rate on May 7 was calculated using the actual average for the period from May 1 to May 7.)
増加比は、1週間前の感染経路不明者数（移動平均値）との比較: Percent increase is compared to the number of people with unknown routes of infection (moving average) one week ago.
感染経路不明者数（7日間移動平均）: Number of people with unknown routes of infection (7-day moving average)
1週間前の新規陽性者の報告数と比較した際の増加比について、有意な数値がとれる3月: The increase in the number of new positive cases compared to the number of new positive cases reported one week ago was prepared from March 29, when significant figures were available.
感染経路不明者数: Number of people with unknown routes of infection
検査結果の判明日を基準とする: Based on the date when the test results are known.
各値は直近1週間の平均値: Each value is an average of the most recent one week.
回復者数の把握には一定の期間を要しており、確認次第数値を更新している: It takes a certain time to ascertain the number of patients who recovered, and the figures will be updated as soon as they are confirmed.
病床稼働率は最新のデータでない可能性あり: The occupancy rate may not be the latest data.
・回復している人数を含む: ・Includes the number of people who recovered.
「濃厚接触者」は、家族や知人などからの感染の可能性が高い方、クラスターに関係する: 'Close contacts' are those who are likely to be infected by family members or acquaintances, or who are related to the cluster.
「回復済」は、退院した方、宿泊療養施設から退所した方を含め、陰性化した方を指す: "Recovered" includes those who were discharged from the hospital or released from residential treatment facilities.
保健所から発生届が提出された日を基準とする: The date of submission of the outbreak report from the health center is the base date.
「軽症」、「中等症」、...、「その他」の割合は、「療養中」に占める割合を示す: The percentages for "minor", "moderate", "..." and "other" indicate the percentage of "under-treatment".
県が公表しておらず、検査実施人数が不明な日は0名と表示される: If the number of people tested is not announced by the prefecture and the number of people tested is unknown, it will be shown as 0.
医療機関等での検査人数、チャーター機帰国者、クルーズ船乗客等は含まれていない: Excluding the number of tests at medical institutions, returnees on charter flights or the cruise ship passengers
「全体に占める割合」＝（計）/（累計陽性者数）で算出。端数の関係上、合計しても必: "Percent of the total" = (total) / (Cumulative number of positives). The total of the percent does not necessarily equal 100% due to fractions.
医療機関等が行った検査も含む: Includes tests performed by medical institutions.
県が整理番号を公表しなくなったため、「回復済」ラベルを消去しました。: The "Recovered" label has been removed because the prefecture no longer publishes the number.
「新規」は、「濃厚接触者」ではない方を指す。渡航歴がある方、県外感染の可能性が高: "New" refers to those who are not "Close contacts". Those with a history of travel, those with a high probability of out-of-county infection (e.g., returning home), and those with an unknown route of infection.
前の1週間の報告数が0の場合、（直近1週間の新規陽性者の報告数平均）＋1で対応し: If the number of reports in the previous week is 0, the number is (the average number of reports of new positive cases in the previous week) + 1
チャーター機帰国者、クルーズ船乗客等は含まれていない: Excluding the returnees on charter flights or the cruise ship passengers
直近1週間の保健所からの新規陽性者の報告数とその前の1週間の報告数の比率。1を上: The ratio of the number of new positive cases reported by the health center in the most recent week to the number reported in the week before, with an increase when above 1 and a decrease when below 1
NaNと表示されている場合には、お手数ですが当サイトの管理者にお知らせください。: If you see "NaN", please inform the administrator of this site. We will fix it as soon as possible.
陽性率：陽性判明数の移動平均／（陽性判明数＋陰性判明数）の移動平均: Positive rate: Moving average of the number of positive results / (number of positive results + number of negative results)
直近1週間の新規陽性者の報告数とその前の1週間の報告数が共に0の場合、増減がない: (Note) If the number of new positive cases reported in the most recent week and the number of cases reported in the week before are both 0, the number is 1 because there is no change.
水戸市「PCR検査ローラー作戦」の状況: Status of the "PCR test roller operation" in Mito City
事前予約制であり、希望者はコールセンターに電話する必要がある: Advance reservations are required and those who wish to do so must call the call center.
民間検査機関が「別枠で」行う検査であり、県衛生研究所等の検査数には含まれない: Inspections are carried out by private laboratories "on a separate basis" and are not included in the number of inspections by prefectural health laboratories, etc.
「PCR検査ローラー作戦」は、水戸市の特定繁華街の店舗従事者及び検査希望者を対象: The "PCR test roller operation" is a free PCR test for store workers in the downtown area of Mito City and for those who wish to be tested.
「濃厚接触者」は、家族や知人などからの感染の可能性が高い方、クラスターに関係する: 'Close contacts' are those who are likely to be infected by family members or acquaintances, or who are related to the cluster.
発生数計: The total number of infected persons
「新規」は、「濃厚接触者」ではない方を指す。渡航歴がある方、県外感染の可能性が高: "New" refers to those who are not "Close contacts". Those with a history of travel, those with a high probability of out-of-county infection (e.g., returning home), and those with an unknown route of infection.
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: Because the results may vary from day to day due to variations in outbreaks of clusters and days of the week, the moving average for the past seven days is shown as a line graph to smooth out these variations and see the overall trend. (For example, the positive rate on July 7 was calculated using the actual average for the period from July 1 to July 7.)

Because the number of cases may vary from day to day due to outbreaks of clusters and days of the week, the moving average of the past seven days was used to calculate the positive rate to smooth out these variations and to see the overall trend. (For example, the positive rate on July 7 was calculated using the actual average for the period from July 1 to July 7.)
第1波は3/17～5/5の期間、第2波は6/20～(現在)の期間を指す: The 1st wave refers to the period from March 17 to May 5 and the 2nd wave refers to the period from June 20 (to current).
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: Because the number of cases may vary from day to day due to outbreaks of clusters and days of the week, the moving average of the past seven days was used to calculate the positive rate to smooth out these variations and to see the overall trend. (For example, the positive rate on April 7 was calculated using the actual average for the period from April 1 to April 7.)

Because the results may vary from day to day due to variations in outbreaks of clusters and days of the week, the moving average for the past seven days is shown as a line graph to smooth out these variations and see the overall trend. (For example, the positive rate on April 7 was calculated using the actual average for the period from April 1 to April 7.)
1週間前の新規陽性者の報告数と比較した際の増加比について、有意な数値がとれる7月: The increase in the number of new positive cases compared to the number of new positive cases reported one week ago was prepared from July 3, when significant figures were available.

「その他」は、県外で療養・回復されている方を指す。茨城県ではデータを管理していな: "Others" refers to people undergoing treatment or recovery outside the prefecture. The Ibaraki Prefecture does not maintain data, so it is not possible to classify people as being under treatment or recovered.
